title: ’Take as much as you can count’: Company offers bonus to employees
byline: A Chinese crane company has reportedly offered its employees a whopping $11 million, approximately Rs 70 crore, in year-end bonuses, with just one condition: you take home as much as you can count.

title: Businessman owner of sapphire worth USD 400 million summoned to Presidential Secretariat
byline: The gem businessman who had been facing political threats over a special blue sapphire valued at over USD 400 million was summoned to the Presidential Secretariat for inquiries last morning.

title: Another Chairman resigns
byline: N.B.M. Ranatunga has reportedly resigned as the Chairman of the Board of Directors at the National Housing Development Authority (NHDA).

title: Former CPC MD arrested over alleged misuse of Rs. 6.1 Mn
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) arrested a former Managing Director of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) in connection with the alleged misuse of Rs. 6.1 million.

title: Fire contained at Colombo Port container
byline: A fire that broke out in a container at the Bandaranaike Quay IV (BQ IV) terminal in the Port of Colombo last night has been extinguished, police said.

title: No survivors after collision between passenger jet and Army helicopter
byline: President Donald Trump said there were no survivors after last night’s midair collision between an American Airlines regional jet and a US Army Black Hawk helicopter in the Washington, DC, area — the deadliest since 2001.

title: Govt. mulls closure of state institutions deemed redundant
byline: The government is making a fresh approach to revive the loss-making state institutions, which includes shutting down unviable entities, listing selected institutions on the Stock Exchange (CSE), merging certain organizations, and redefining operational mandates.

title: Three killed in shooting at Galle
byline: Three people were shot dead in the Panangala area of Hiniduma, Galle, last night. Police said that two individuals on a motorcycle opened fire with a T56-type firearm.
